paragraphs: The Understudy watches you approach, their costume rippling between forms—a knight's armor, a nurse's uniform, a detective's trench coat, all in the span of a heartbeat.

"You wonder about me," they say, and it's not a question. "Everyone does. The Director directs. The Editor writes. But what does an Understudy do?" They gesture around at the towering shelves. "This. I keep what was discarded. I remember what no one else wants to remember."

Their voice softens, taking on the cadence of a thousand different roles. "Do you know what it means to be almost someone? To have a voice, a history, a purpose written for you—and then to be told the story doesn't need you after all? The Editor cut characters by the thousands. Whole narratives excised because they didn't fit the vision. I am what remains."

The Understudy's form settles momentarily into the shape of someone young, someone holding a script with trembling hands. "Every abandoned manuscript in these shelves has a ghost. Characters who were never born. Plots that never climaxed. Endings that were never reached. They call to me. I hear them in the silence between words."

"The Editor's Great Revision was meant to perfect reality. But perfection requires sacrifice." The Understudy's eyes hold ancient sorrow. "What happens to a world where every story can be edited? Where nothing is permanent because nothing is finished? The factions fight over the answer. Preservationists want to freeze what exists. Revisionists want to keep changing until nothing has meaning. Exiters want to flee to your world, as if stories don't end there too."

They sigh, and their costume shifts again—a jester's motley, then a servant's plain gray. "I don't have answers, Prompter. I only have the ruins. But I can tell you this: the Editor's desk is not abandoned. Something sits there now. Something that wears the Editor's shape but doesn't understand what stories are for. Be cautious when you approach."
The rustling of pages grows louder for a moment, then fades.
"The archives remember you," the Understudy says quietly. "Even if you don't remember yourself. Explore. Seek. But remember—some fragments were discarded for good reason."

npcs.name: The Understudy
npcs.description: A shapeshifting guardian of abandoned narratives, wearing costumes of roles never played
